availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, miner. Native of England. Married to Margaret Harlan Davidson in Hancock County, Kentucky, on October 30, 1851. Father of John Davidson, Jane Davidson, and Thomas Davidson. Married to Sarah Davidson. Father of Benjamin Davidson and Isabelle Davidson. Iron foundry worker in New Haven, Connecticut, in 1850. Resident in Hancock County, Kentucky, in 1860. Miner in Hancock County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Connecticut, Derby County, New Haven, p. 281A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 1045.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Vanderburgh County, Evansville, Ward 6, p. 314B-315A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Hancock County, KY, July and August 1863, p. 6.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994037, Hancock County Births, p. 3.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Hancock County Marriages, 1829-1900, Film #000495729, p. 67.
